_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Drayton Foods continues to place a high priority on chemical safety. Drayton Foods maintains 3 - shift coverage seven days per week at the Fargo, ND facility with one designated person on call during the evening hours and over the weekend.

Drayton Foods manufactures frozen dough products. Anhydrous ammonia is used in the refrigeration system at this facility. Ammonia is the most efficient and environmentally compatible refrigerant available. Although it is toxic at high concentration and is an irritating gas, it is not a cumulative metabolic poison, does not cause cancer or other dread diseases and does not cause lasting environmental damage. The refrigeration system at this facility has a capacity of about 13,100 pounds of ammonia, but normally operates at approximately 5,000 to 6,000 pounds.

Drayton Foods calculates ammonia worst case release scenarios using the Model RMP for Ammonia Refrigeration, May 1996. Drayton Foods' manufacturing facility is located in an area that meets the definition of "urban". Drayton Foods has chosen to calculate worst case release poundage for the largest high-pressure receiver in the system, filled to full calculated hydraulic capacity. Reduced volume for administrative controls was not used, since the described scenario would probably occur only as a result of a catastrophic vessel rupture caused by a total filling of the vessel, closure of all vessel block valves, and failure of all pressure relief valves, with a simultaneous increase in liquid temperature sufficient to overpressure the vessel to the point of failure.

A release rate of 100 lb./min. will be used as an alternate case scenario as suggested in the Model RMP.

The "urban" site condition will be used.

Based on the above, the worst-case ammonia release scenario for the facility will be 6,700 pounds released over a 10-minute period. The alternate case will be a release rate of 100 pounds per minute.

The ammonia refrigeration system is covered by the OSHA Process Safet

y Management (PSM) rule, 29 CFR 1910.119.

The Fargo, ND facility has implemented and conducts training on the written respiratory program for all maintenance and sanitation personnel. The training is conducted and facilitated by the company's Safety Professionals along with fit-testing conducted by the Designated Medical Provider for Occupation Health. The training was designed with a heavy emphasis on ammonia safety and personal protective equipment. The Emergency Response Plan indicates that all employees must evacuate the facility and contact the local Fire Department if a release should occur. Copies of emergency plans are filed with the Fire Department and annual facility walk-throughs are conducted with the Fargo Fire Department annually. Preplanned command posts and gathering/staging areas have been designated and a post-incident debriefing will be conducted after each incident.

Since a continuous improvement philosophy is deeply imbedded in the Drayton Foods corporate culture, improvements in system safety are implemented as a result of employee-based teams and as a result of system engineering modifications and extensions. Post incident debriefings and incident investigations are used to identify additional improvements to system safety.
